title: Do you like ARURF?
body: I'm interested in what the community thinks about why they feel ARURF is a failure or a success. Hopefully Riot can learn and grow accordingly. I, myself, haven't had the opportunity to play yet but I'd love to see what this is like. Share your thoughts!

I think ARURF was a failure. Not because of what they did, but what they failed to do. They made it healthier and unhealthier.
It's healthier because the randomness makes it easier for new players, because no one is guaranteed getting their main champ anymore. It's unhealthy *because* no one is guaranteed getting their main champ anymore but are still able to...add in that the random champs given to you to play can even be part of the Free-2-Use roster which consists of champs you've most likely never played at all, and you're going to have a bad time. It feels pretty bad when you have a toxic Diana or Singed that don't know how to play their Champ, and then they spam the chat because they're toxic little shits who shouldn't even be allowed to play LoL in the first place. 
I also think it's bad because of the reason randomness was in only one lane before. Randomness is supposed to be a "nerf" in its own right to the game while also being fun because of that randomness, but it was only able to be balanced by having a single lane where everyone -- no matter their experience -- could enjoy playing champs from outside their comfort zone. But ARURF tips that on its head because now it's 3 lanes and a full jungle quadrant of "oh look I got ganked by an Alistar who's taking me dry to kingdom come and back" without even having the security of knowing how to use your own champ to outplay him.
Which is another point. URF is supposed to be incredibly fast-paced even more so than Summoner's Rift, to the point where it takes raw experience to be able to outplay overwhelming odds. Being incapable of choosing your own champion, and even potentially getting a champ you've never seen before, ruins that because now you have learn on the fly a champ you're likely to feed as anyhow.
My solution would be to change it to Twisted Treeline. 1) No one cared about the Jungle in URF or ARURF, 2) a large population of players now have close-to-no experience in playing most champs they play in ARURF, and having a smaller map and smaller jungle would make it easier to play for newer and veteran players alike, 3) because URF was already fast-paced, so a full lane removed from the equation won't change much, and 4) because removing 2 players from the match would make games be more based on outplaying your opponents instead of teamfighting or running from your opponent's full team (1v5s have always been terrible in URF, but they've been managable because you knew how to play your champ and outplay them; having only 3 opponents -- and 2 allies at the same time -- is healthier in this kind of fast-paced randomized gameplay).
So there ya go. I doubt Riot will see or notice this at all, because they rarely pay attention to any posts that don't specifically call for Meddler, so I have no hopes for URF to come back from its dump in the future. They already ruined Ascension and Dominion and haven't done anything about them, so why would they fix URF?
